summary: Completed comprehensive testing of MNASE Basketball League sports management website. Backend APIs are fully functional (100% success rate), but critical frontend integration issues found that prevent event registration and facility booking flows from working properly.

critical_bugs.issue: API call mismatch - frontend sends event_id as query parameter but backend expects it in request body
critical_bugs.error_details: Frontend: POST /api/registrations/checkout?event_id=event-001 with {origin_url} in body. Backend expects: POST /api/registrations/checkout with {event_id, origin_url} in body
critical_bugs.impact: Event registration completely broken - returns 422 error

critical_bugs.issue: React error boundary missing - backend error objects rendered as React children
critical_bugs.error_details: Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {type, loc, msg, input, url})
critical_bugs.impact: Frontend crashes when API errors occur, making app unusable

critical_bugs.issue: Similar API contract mismatch likely exists for facility booking
critical_bugs.impact: Facility booking flow probably broken (couldn't test due to frontend crash)

integration_issues.issue: Frontend-backend API contract mismatch prevents successful registration
Backend validation errors not properly handled in frontend

passed_tests: Backend API authentication (user registration, login, JWT validation)
Backend CRUD operations for events and facilities
Backend admin functionality (create, update, delete events/facilities)
Frontend user registration and login flow
All backend endpoints return correct status codes and data
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix API contract mismatch in event registration - frontend should send event_id in request body, not query parameter. Add proper error boundary to handle backend validation errors. Similar fix likely needed for facility booking endpoint.
